content.description: <math alttext="The figure shows a two row table with four columns of data. The heading for row 1 is “t.” The heading for row 2 is “f of t.” The data in the table are as follows. Column 1. t is 0. f of t is 12. Column 2. t is 2. f of t is 36. Column 3. t is 3. f of t is 48. Column 4. t is 6. f of t is 42." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnlines="solid" equalcolumns="true" equalrows="true" frame="solid" rowlines="solid" width="auto"><mtr><mtd><mi>t</mi></mtd><mtd><mn>0</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>2</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>6</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mn>12</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>36</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>48</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>42</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: The function <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is continuous on the closed interval <math alttext="open bracket, 0 comma 6, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></math> and has values given in the table above. What is the approximation to <math alttext="the integral from 0 to 6, of, f of t, d t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math> obtained by using a right Riemann sum with the subintervals <math alttext="open bracket, 0 comma 2, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></math>, <math alttext="open bracket, 2 comma 3, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></math>, and <math alttext="open bracket, 3 comma 6, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></math> ?

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
